# Pandoc Feature Coverage

This fixture tests Pandoc-specific syntax that's supported by the grammar.

## Inline Formatting Extensions

Regular *italic* and **bold** text.

Strikethrough: ~~deleted text~~

Highlight: ==highlighted text==

Subscript: H~2~O and CO~2~

Superscript: x^2^ + y^2^ = z^2^

Underline: [underlined text]{.underline}

Combined: ***bold and italic*** or **_also bold and italic_**

## Attribute Spans

This is [regular text]{.red} with a class attribute.

You can also use [multiple]{.class1 .class2 #myid key="value"} attributes.

## Links

Inline link: [link text](https://example.com)

Reference-style link: [link text][ref]

[ref]: https://example.com "Optional title"

Implicit reference: [Google]

[Google]: https://google.com

Auto-link: <https://example.com>

Email: <user@example.com>

## Citations

Single citation: @smith2024

Citation in brackets: [@jones2023]

Multiple citations: [@smith2024; @jones2023]

Citation with locator: [@smith2024, p. 42]

Citation with prefix and suffix: [see @smith2024, pp. 30-35; also @jones2023]

Inline citation: @smith2024 says that...

Suppress author: [-@smith2024]

## Cross-references

See @fig-plot for the visualization.

Refer to @tbl-data for the summary statistics.

Check @sec-intro for background information.

Equation reference: @eq-formula

## Footnotes

Here's a footnote reference[^1] in text.

Here's another one[^longnote].

Inline footnote: ^[This is an inline footnote.]

[^1]: This is the footnote content.

[^longnote]: Here's a longer footnote with multiple paragraphs.

    Second paragraph of the footnote.

| 123   | 123  | 123    | 123     |

Table with caption: [Table caption text]

## Math

Inline math: $E = mc^2$

Display math:

$$
\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-x^2} dx = \sqrt{\pi}
$$

Multiple equations:

$$
\begin{aligned}
f(x) &= x^2 + 2x + 1 \\
     &= (x + 1)^2
\end{aligned}
$$

>

>

## Lists

Unordered list:

- Item 1
- Item 2
  - Nested item 2.1
  - Nested item 2.2
- Item 3

Ordered list:

1. First item
2. Second item
   a. Nested item 2.a
   b. Nested item 2.b
3. Third item

Task list:

- [x] Completed task
- [ ] Incomplete task
- [ ] Another task

## Code Chunks with #| Options

```{python}
#| label: fig-example
#| fig-cap: "Example plot"
#| echo: false
#| warning: false

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.plot([1, 2, 3], [1, 4, 9])
plt.show()
```

```{r}
#| label: tbl-summary
#| tbl-cap: "Summary statistics"
#| output: true

summary(mtcars)
```

## Shortcodes

## Raw Blocks and Inline

Raw HTML block:

```{=html}
<div class="custom">
  <p>Raw HTML content</p>
</div>
```

Raw LaTeX block:

```{=latex}
\begin{equation}
  E = mc^2
\end{equation}
```

Inline raw HTML: `<span class="red">red text</span>`{=html}

Inline raw LaTeX: `$\alpha$`{=latex}

## Percent Metadata

% Alternative Title
% Alternative Author
% 2024-01-15

This is an alternative way to specify metadata in Pandoc.

## Horizontal Rules

Three or more hyphens:

---

Three or more asterisks:

***

Three or more underscores:

___
